column1: Biden is currently polling at 43.78%, while Trump is at 44.14%.

The closest states are Nevada (7.42% Biden, 92.58% Trump), Maine (13.17% Biden, 86.83% Trump), Georgia (13.23% Biden, 86.77% Trump), Michigan (16.82% Biden, 83.18% Trump), North Carolina (17.77% Biden, 82.23% Trump), Arizona (18.78% Biden, 81.22% Trump), Wisconsin (29.57% Biden, 70.43% Trump), Pennsylvania (36.47% Biden, 63.53% Trump), Nebraska CD-1 (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), Nebraska CD-3 (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), DC (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), Delaware (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), Hawaii (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), Nebraska CD-2 (50.00% Biden, 50.00% Trump), Minnesota (67.94% Biden, 32.06% Trump), Virginia (80.64% Biden, 19.36% Trump), New Jersey (88.03% Biden, 11.97% Trump), New Hampshire (91.78% Biden, 8.22% Trump), New Mexico (93.24% Biden, 6.76% Trump).
Biden has an 28.05% chance of winning the election, Trump has an 71.50% chance of winning the election, and there is an 0.45% chance of a tie.
Biden is expected to win 234 electoral votes, while Trump is expected to win 304 electoral votes.
